clinical_study.brief_title: Rehabilitation Gaming System for Cerebral Palsy
clinical_study.official_title: Motor and Cognitive Training With the Rehabilitation Gaming System for Patients Affected by Cerebral Palsy

brief_summary.textblock: In this study the investigators evaluate the effectivity of Virtual Reality-based rehabilitation protocols for preventing motor deterioration in patients with cerebral palsy.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in motor function of the affected extremity as measured by MACS clinical scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to week 5 (End of Treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in attention and visuo-perceptive and visuo-constructional apraxia as measured by the WAIS-III scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to week 5 (End of Treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in motor function of the affected extremity as measured by the Box and Blocks clinical scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to week 5 (End of Treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the amount of use of the affected arm during training as measured by the Virtual Reality system
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to week 5 (End of Treatment)

arm_group.description: Subjects will perform 3 different training protocols in Virtual Reality that imply performing tasks of vertical and planar reaching and hitting spheres, or hockey pucks, spaced at different time, speed and color.
Subjects will perform conventional rehabilitation tasks for the upper-extremities that imply vertical and planar reaching movements.

intervention.description: Subjects will perform 3 different training protocols in Virtual Reality that imply performing tasks of vertical and planar reaching and hitting spheres, or hockey pucks, spaced at different time, speed and color.
Subjects will perform conventional rehabilitation tasks for the upper-extremities that imply vertical and planar reaching movements.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children and Adult patients between 12- 50 years old diagnosed with CP according to Gross Motor Function Classification System (GMFCS). Level of disability between I and IV.
- Ashworth modified clinical scale < 3 (Ashworth, 1964, Bohannon Bohannon and Smith, 1987).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe visual impairment.
- Severe cognitive impairment such as mental retardation which impedes the understanding of the task.
